result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. ROCKLEWITZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Identity Theft-Financial Gain [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • PTC Identity Theft-Financial Gain [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Provide DNA sample. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with Christopher Loucks, Brittany Ramon, Taylor Baxter, Bruce Suettinger, Manitowoc Walmart, Manitowoc Walgreens, Charles Adams, Tany Pivonka-Dewane and contact with Lauren Free will be as directed by the agent;

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law, on each count, concurrent, but to commence immediately upon completion of the condition time in 15 CF 455.

Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 12-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.    
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 11-23-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with Tanya L. Pivonka-Dewane.   Bail not furnished.   Defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.   Copy filed.   
Minutes.

RE:  Tanya Pivonka-Dewane, on 05-26-15.
Initial appearance is set for 11-16-15 at 2:30 p.m.
